entries.content: A hidden, multi-tiered Linghou settlement in a mist-filled valley of the Dragon's Crown, built amongst Sky-Pines and glowing Spirit-Caps. Inhabited by the Whisperwood Troop, known for 'Mistdew Wine' and elusiveness. Threats include Shanyuan patrols (Ironpelts), rival Linghou, and Roc-Eagles. Ambient psychoactive spores and Ada's wild energies permeate the grove, with mischievous Fae-like spirits. Power players include Elder Hua (matriarch, wine recipe keeper) and Quickpaw (cunning scout, nascent Agile Flow cultivator). Beliefs involve animistic reverence for ancient trees, the 'Great Glowcap', and forest spirits, with some tales of Ada as a nature deity.

entries.title: Broken Spear Tribe
entries.content: A Banished Kin tribe on Huna known for a rare lineage of individuals with primal cultivation abilities focused on survival and hunting.

entries.title: Yingmo
entries.content: A type of Mozu serving Lassenia. Lithe and deceptive, capable of manipulating emotions and weaving illusions. May originate from corrupted Fae or shadowed Kinneret-Shen.

entries.title: Yurts of Scale and Hide
entries.content: Typical dwellings of the nomadic Banished Kin on Huna, sturdy hide tents reinforced with bone and driftwood, arranged in circular patterns.

entries.title: School of Aetheric Transmutation
entries.content: A school of Arcane Magic combining Runic theory with practical experimentation to reshape matter and energy. Practitioners are artificers and creators of magical materials/devices.

entries.title: Asipatra
entries.content: Lassenia's hidden, shadow-wrought pocket dimension, granted by the First Mover. A realm of eternal twilight where she rules as a goddess and created her demonic followers.

entries.title: River Reed School
entries.content: A nascent Ren cultivator sect on Huna, found along the Great Serpent River, known for water navigation and healing herbs. Rarely exceeds 30-40 members.

entries.title: Heaven-Sent Artifacts (Artifact Tier 5)
entries.content: Cultivator artifacts whose origins lie in celestial events or materials from beyond Malkuth, such as Sky-Shards or meteorites. Their properties can be unusual and tied to cosmic forces.

entries.title: Tianling Technology
entries.content: The Tianling of the North-Western Spearhead have developed unique crafts out of necessity, including advanced stone-shaping, resonant dampeners for their structures, and weather-warding Runic Arrays.

entries.title: Void Comprehending
entries.content: A transcendent cultivation realm where practitioners perceive and interact with deeper layers of reality like Void Essence and the Cosmic Web, developing spatial manipulation abilities. Substages: Early (Void Glimpsing), Middle (Void Merging), Late (Void Shattering), Peak (Void Mastering).

entries.title: Twofold Essence of Vitality
entries.content: A foundational pattern, a spiraling echo of Taiji, imbued by the Creator into Malkuth's nascent oceans. This catalyzed the evolution of more complex life forms.

entries.title: Dao Pills (Grade 6)
entries.content: Mythical alchemical pills that are more like solidified Dao principles. Consuming one might grant direct enlightenment, permanently transform a Spirit Root (extremely rare), or allow a glimpse into the First Mover's dream. Creation is beyond typical alchemy.

entries.title: Void Essence
entries.content: The unmanifested Profound Dark Qi, the Primordial Yin of the cosmos, found in the depths of the Primordial Ocean. It represents pure potentiality and connects to the 'Bulk' of realities. Direct cultivation is perilous.

entries.title: Geothermal Dragon Hide
entries.content: The hide of Geothermal Dragons like Kelos, or their kin. Likely possesses fire-resistant and durable properties, used for enchanted vestments by Arcanists.

entries.title: Sanguine
entries.content: An awe-inspiring, godlike being wreathed in concentric rings and cosmic spirals, one of the forms in which the Moon Deities witnessed the First Mover. Associated with blood, life, and primal power. Guided the Banished Kin to Huna and empowered Lassenia.

entries.title: Void-Touched Root
entries.content: A Variant Spirit Root with a direct and dangerous affinity for Void Essence, offering esoteric power but high risk of corruption.

entries.title: Yanshi
entries.content: Imira's direct creations, beings appearing crafted from living stone and earth, often with veins of amethyst and other crystals. They live deep within Malkuth (e.g., roots of Dragon's Crown Peaks), are serene, wise, and powerful cultivators deeply attuned to the earth and Imira's Dao (Earth-Attunement).

entries.title: Wuji
entries.content: The Daoist concept of the formless Void or the Unmanifest, representing the primordial, undifferentiated state from which the universe and Taiji arose, as part of the First Mover's dream.

entries.title: Taiji
entries.content: The Daoist concept of the Supreme Ultimate, representing the dynamic interplay and dance of Yin and Yang, into which Wuji unfolded during the First Mover's act of creation.

entries.title: Snow-Stalkers
entries.content: Massive, shaggy, white-furred apex predators resembling giant bears with saber-like teeth, inhabiting the Dragon's Crown Peaks.

entries.title: Domain (Cultivation)
entries.content: An area around a Soul Formation (or higher) cultivator where their understanding of their specific Dao grants them significant influence over ambient energies and local reality laws pertaining to their specialization.

entries.title: School of Celestial Cartography
entries.content: A school of Arcane Magic focused on astromancy, divination via celestial alignments, and understanding cosmic destiny. Practitioners are often advisors, navigators, and prophets.

entries.title: Body Tempering Disciplines
entries.content: Cultivation methods dedicated to strengthening and transforming the physical form to superhuman levels, often involving rigorous, painful, and resource-intensive processes. Includes Primal Strength Methods, Alchemical Body Tempering, and Dao-Resonant Physique Arts.

entries.title: Hidden Realms
entries.content: Personal domains or pocket dimensions maintained by the Moon Deities (Imira, Ada, Jeru) and potentially other powerful entities like Grand Ascension cultivators.

entries.title: Earth Grade Technique
entries.content: Powerful and often complex cultivation techniques (Gōngfǎ), usually held by established sects or clans. Can lead to significant power within a realm.

entries.title: Nascent Soul
entries.content: The fourth major realm of Cultivation. The Golden Core 'hatches', giving birth to a miniature spiritual replica (Nascent Soul) capable of leaving the body and wielding immense spiritual power. Substages: Early, Middle, Late, Peak.
